The Red Book of Westmarch (sometimes Red Book of the Hobbitsnath) is the book in which the legendarium of Middle-earth was written. It is bound in red leather.
The first Red Book was written as a diary by the Hobbits Bilbo Baggins and recounted his quest for Lonely Mountain
column2: which he called There and Back Again. Within it
column3: he compiled Elven lore while he retired to Rivendell (Translations from the Elvish)  where he gave it to Frodo.

Together with extracts from Books of Lore translated by Bilbo in Rivendell.
The book contained Bilbos translations of Elven legends from the Elder Days
column2: and various Hobbit poems. A lot of background information on the realms of Arnor
column4: and Rohan was added to it by Peregrin Took and Meriadoc Brandybuck from their contacts in Rohan and Gondor. Other material was provided by Aragorn.

column1: ==Inspiration==
Tolkiens inspiration for this repository of lore was the real Wikipedia:Red Book of Hergest
column2: the early 15th century compilation of Welsh history and poetry that contains the manuscript of the Mabinogion. Bound (and rebound) in red leather
column5: the manuscript was well known to Tolkien.

column3: and it therefore must be supposed that copies of the book survived throughout several Ages.
